about.title: ABOUT ME
about.bio: I am a 3rd-year Computer Science student, passionate about data manipulation and particularly advancements in artificial intelligence. I am constantly seeking new opportunities to develop my skills in data analysis and processing. I am ready to take on new challenges and contribute to the success of projects.

shortTerm.title: Short Term Goal
shortTerm.description: Join a school to enhance my knowledge in AI development and optimization.

longTerm.title: Long Term Goal
longTerm.description: Work in AI research or development.

brainTumor.title: Brain Tumor Detection AI
brainTumor.subtitle: Developed a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for automated brain tumor detection from MRI scans, achieving 93% accuracy in tumor classification.

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.description: Developed a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) model for automated classification of brain tumor MRI scans into four distinct categories: glioma, meningioma, no tumor, and pituitary tumor. This project demonstrates the practical application of deep learning in medical diagnosis support.

challenge.title: Challenge
challenge.description: The main challenge was to create a reliable classification system that could accurately distinguish between different types of brain tumors while maintaining high precision across all categories. This required careful model architecture design and extensive training data optimization.

performance.title: Model Performance
performance.matrixDesc: Detailed classification results across tumor types

notebook.title: Complete Implementation Details
notebook.description: Below is the complete implementation of the brain tumor detection model, including data processing, model architecture, training, and evaluation.

multispectral.title: SimulFCImage | Multispectral Image Viewer
multispectral.indexDescription: Led the development of a professional software tool for the ImViA Laboratory, enabling visualization and analysis of multispectral images through various simulation methods.
multispectral.subtitle: A professional project developed for ImViA Laboratory (Dijon) during my final year of Bachelor's degree in Computer Science

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.description: SimulFCImage is a tool designed for manipulating multispectral images, enabling users to visualize them in various color representations. The application provides multiple simulation methods, from true color generation to specialized visualizations like bee vision simulation.

concept.title: Understanding Multispectral Images

whatIs.title: What is a Multispectral Image?
whatIs.description: A multispectral image consists of several bands, each capturing light at different wavelengths. Unlike regular RGB images that only capture visible light, multispectral images can capture information beyond human vision, including infrared and ultraviolet wavelengths.

understandingBands.title: Understanding Bands
understandingBands.description: Each band in a multispectral image represents the intensity of light at a specific wavelength. For example, a single band might show how strongly a scene reflects light at 550nm (green light). These bands can be combined in various ways to reveal different aspects of the captured scene.

concept.bandExample: Example of a single spectral band (grayscale representation)

design.title: User-Friendly Design
design.description: The application features an intuitive interface that allows users to:

preview.caption: SimulFCImage main interface with band navigation and simulation options

falseColor.title: False Color Generation
falseColor.description: Custom RGB band selection for specialized visualization where the user can choose the bands to be displayed, in this case, the red is assigned to the 167th band, the green to the 32th band and the blue to the 86th band

beeVision.title: Bee Vision Simulation
beeVision.description: Simulates how bees perceive multispectral images

architecture.title: Technical Architecture
architecture.description: The application follows a modern 6-layer architecture designed for maintainability and scalability:

layers.hmi: HMI (Human Machine Interface): Handles the visual interface and user interactions
layers.builder: Builder: Manages widget creation using the Builder pattern
layers.logic: LogicLayer: Contains core logic for multispectral image processing
layers.factory: Factory: Implements abstract factory pattern for simulation methods
layers.managers: Managers: Handles file operations and resource management
layers.exceptions: Exceptions: Custom exception handling for application-specific errors

trueColor.description: Generates natural color representation as seen by human eyes

portfolio.title: Portfolio Website
portfolio.description: Designed and developed a responsive professional portfolio website using modern web technologies and best practices.
